p: SARS-CoV-2 represents an incubation period of 6.4 days, fluctuating between 2.1 and 11.1 days with possible asymptomatic transmission [ 64]. Infection is manifested after the incubation period. The period from the commencement of disease leading to death fluctuates between 6 and 41 days with an average of 14 days. The age of patient and condition of the immune system are the sole determinants of this period. Persons with a weaker immune system are more susceptible to infection. This period is shorter in geriatrics >60 years, as older patients have a weaker immune system [ 65]. The most common symptoms of COVID-19 are dry cough, myalgia, diarrhea, headache, and high-grade fever [ 66]; fever is reported in more than 90% of cases, cough in 75%, and dyspnea in 50% of the patients [ 8].
